definition: a fit of weeping, to shed tears because of sadness, rage, or pain
details:
noun
- a fit of weeping
= example: a fit of weeping
- a loud utterance
= synonyms: call
- a loud utterance of emotion (especially when inarticulate)
= example: a loud utterance of emotion (especially when inarticulate)
= synonyms: yell
- a slogan used to rally support for a cause
= example: a slogan used to rally support for a cause
= synonyms: watchword
- the characteristic utterance of an animal
verb
- to shed tears because of sadness, rage, or pain
= example: to shed tears because of sadness, rage, or pain
= synonyms: weep
- to bring into a particular state by crying
- to utter aloud
= synonyms: outcry, shout, say, call out, exclaim, cry out
- to utter a sudden loud cry
= synonyms: call
- to proclaim or announce in public
= example: to proclaim or announce in public
= synonyms: blazon out
- to utter a characteristic sound
= example: to utter a characteristic sound
- to demand immediate action
= example: to demand immediate action
